snippet.title: AUSTRALIAN STOCKS SLIP: Here's what you need to know
snippet.content:
Australian shares closed lower.
Today's scoreboard:
ASX 200: 5,744.20 -28.17 -0.49%
All Ordinaries: 5,794.50 -26.13 -0.45%
AUD/USD: 0.7964 -0.0005 -0.06%
The local market slipped after two days of gaining ground, with financial stocks and miners leading the way down.
Westpac was down almost 1% to $31.76 and BHP 1.5% to $25.75.
Medical device maker ResMed dropped 5.7% to $9.105 after reporting a 7% increase in revenue to $US556.7 million for the fourth quarter.
Education group, Navitas (NVT) was down 3.3% to $4.32 after posting a 10.8% fall in full year profit to $80.3 million.
Top stories:
1. These stocks are feeling it.
2. According to the Australian Bureau of Statistics, total approvals surged by 10.9% to 18,453 in June in seasonally adjusted terms, breezing past expectations for an increase of 1%.
3. The Australian Bureau of Statistics Selected Living Cost Index report has a story to tell.
4. Its shares jumped on a buyback by almost 6% to close at $3.20.
5. Contango Asset Management gets pinged by the ASX.
6. Webjet has gone into a trading halt pending an announcement and a capital raising to fund it.
7. She replaces the streaming service's inaugural local MD, Kate Vale, who left in May.
8. They also like the sound of the lifestyle in Australia.
